III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio
Section (1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written staff-to-
Description resident ratio formula for direct care workers.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The facility is currently out of compliance with staff to youth ratio.
Investigation Interviews
On 8/19/2025 an onsite, unannounced visit was made to
Havenwyck. The agency was found to be in non-compliance with
the 5 to 1 staffing ratio. A tour of the facility was provided by
Clinician. She denied knowledge of required staffing ratio for the
facility. During the tour, I was able to observe both Classroom 1
and Classroom 2 to be staffed at a ratio greater than 5 to 1.
Classroom 1 had 8 youth and 1 staff and Classroom 2 had 12
youth and 2 staff.
On 8/19/2025 an interview was completed with Staff 3 and he
reported his knowledge of the staffing ratio for the agency to be 8
to 1 during waking hours.
On 9/4/2025 an onsite visit was made to Havenwyck. The agency
was found to be in non-compliance with the agency policy of 5 to 1
staffing ratio during waking hours. Classroom had 10 youth and 1
staff.
On 9/4/2025 Youth B, Youth C and Youth D were interviewed. All
three youth reported that the agency does not have enough staff
and could not confirm they are always staffed at the 5 to 1 ratio.
They denied ever being unsupervised at the facility and reported
feeling safe.
On 9/4/2025 Staff 2 was interviewed. She denied knowledge of
the agency operating outside of the 5 to 1 staffing ratio. She did
report that the agency is short staffed and she works 60 to 70
hours per week picking up additional shifts to provide coverage.
On 9/4/2025 Supervisor was interviewed. She denied knowledge
of agency operating outside of the 5 to 1 ratio. She expressed
some challenges with the new scheduling system that is being
utilized by the agency but reported working collaboratively with
management to ensure proper staffing and ratio coverage.
On 9/4/2025 Staff 1 was interviewed. He reported that staffing is
a daily issue at the agency, and they are out of ratio compliance
almost daily.
2

On 9/5/2025 an onsite visit was made to Havenwyck. The agency
was found to be in non-compliance with the agency policy of 5 to 1
staffing ratio. Classroom 1 had 10 youth and 1 staff person.
Documents Reviewed
Havenwyck Appropriate Staffing Level Policy – Each resident unit
will have the minimum number of staff per the State of Michigan
requirements staffing to maintain the required ratio at all times;
During normal waking hours, the staffing ratio will be 5:1 and
during sleeping hours the ratio will be 8:1.
Tour of Facility
A tour of the agency was completed on 8/19/2025, 09/04/2025
and 09/05/2025. On each date, the agency was found to be out of
ratio compliance
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with the licensing rule. Upon arrival of the
consultant for both unannounced and announced agency visits,
staffing ratio was not consistent with agency policy.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
